item.description: (Alma 43–48) A grandfather uses Captain Moroni as an example of a true hero for his grandson. Moroni’s faith and loyalty to the Savior provide an example that all Saints should follow. Segment 1, Captain Moron.

item.description: (Moroni 10:20–23) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf talks about hope.

item.title: Receiving a Testimony of the Book of Mormon, 2
item.description: (Moroni 10:4-5) Elder Bruce R. McConkie calls each of us to earnestly seek to know the truthfulness of the Book of Mormon

item.title: Receiving a Testimony of the Book of Mormon, Part 1
item.description: (Moroni 10:4–5) President Boyd K. Packer shares his experiences in gaining a testimony of the truthfulness of the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Test Moroni’s Promise
item.description: (Moroni 10:3–5) Elder Richard G. Scott talks about testing Moroni’s promise.

item.title: Children Are Alive in Christ
item.description: (Moroni 8:4–23) President Boyd K. Packer gave personal examples of how children are alive in Christ.

item.title: Pure Love of Christ
item.description: (Moroni 7:45–48) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland talks about the pure love of Christ and the connections open to us.

item.title: Charity: The Pure Love of Christ
item.description: (Moroni 7:44-48) Charity is not an act, but a state of being. It is something we become.

item.title: Light of Christ
item.description: (Moroni 7:12–19) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin talks about the importance of the Light of Christ.

item.title: Retaining Converts
item.description: (Moroni 6:4–9) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin expresses the importance of reaching out to new converts.

item.title: Fellowshipping, 2
item.description: (Moroni 6:4) President Gordon B. Hinckley talks about fellowshipping new converts.

item.title: Fellowshipping, 1
item.description: (Moroni 6:4) President Gordon B. Hinckley talks about fellowshipping new converts.

item.title: The Importance of Ordinances in the Church of Jesus Christ, 2
item.description: (Moroni 2–5) President Boyd K. Packer teaches that without covenants, even good conduct cannot redeem nor exalt mankind.

item.title: The Importance of Ordinances in the Church of Jesus Christ, 1
item.description: (Moroni 2–5) President Boyd K. Packer shares the credentials required to return to Heavenly Father and the challenge to keep covenants in this life.

item.title: I, Moroni
item.description: (Moroni 1:1–4) With his story of ferocious wolves, Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin instructs us to keep our testimonies strong to withstand Satan’s temptations.

item.title: I, Moroni, Will Not Deny the Christ
item.description: (Moroni 1) Sister Susan W. Tanner talks about what we can do to prevail amid loneliness. We must cling to the Lord’s promises.

item.title: The Trial of Your Faith
item.description: (Ether 12:6) Elder Richard G. Scott teaches that by acting upon impressions, you will receive confirming evidences of the Spirit, which strengthens your faith.

item.title: Great Faith Precedes Miracles
item.description: (Ether 12:5-22) President James E. Faust testifies that great faith is essential in overcoming challenges.

item.title: Trial of Your Faith
item.description: (Ether 12:4–6) President Boyd K. Packer gives a personal example about “the trial of your faith”. (“The Book of Mormon: Another Testament of Jesus Christ—Plain and Precious Things, Ensign, May 2005, 6–9.)

item.title: Secret Combinations Destroy Civilizations
item.description: (Ether 8:20–26) Elder M. Russell Ballard speaks of the destructive power of secret combinations in today’s society.

item.title: A Steady, Reassuring Voice
item.description: (Ether 7:23–27) Elder Robert D. Hales teaches us to listen to the living prophets.

item.title: Testimony of the Witnesses
item.description: (Ether 5) Elder Dallin H. Oaks shares the significance of more than one witness to the Book of Mormon.

item.title: The Faith and Diligence of the Brother of Jared
item.description: (Ether 2:16; 3:5) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about the faith and diligence of the brother of Jared.

item.title: Written for Us Today
item.description: (Mormon 8:34–35) President Ezra Taft Benson explains that the Book of Mormon was meant for our generation. We must, therefore, make it a center point of our study.

item.title: Prepared for Our Day
item.description: (Mormon 8:12–41) Elder L. Tom Perry explains that the Book of Mormon was prepared for our day.

item.title: Bible and Book of Mormon
item.description: (Mormon 7:8–10) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about the Bible and the Book of Mormon as witnesses of Jesus Christ.

item.title: In the Hands of God
item.description: (Mormon 5:23) Elder W. Craig Zwick talks about the keys we need to feel comfort and to receive direction from the Lord.

item.title: We Can Choose Our Path
item.description: (4 Nephi 1:20–42) Elder Richard G. Scott teaches that we cannot choose the consequences of our actions.

item.title: There Were No “Manner of –Ites”
item.description: (4 Nephi 1:16–17) Elder Richard G. Scott testifies that by aligning our traditions or customs with the Lord, we are promised happiness.

item.title: There Were "No Manner of -Ites"
item.description: (4th Nephi 1:16-17) President Faust talks about needing to find the value in one another and unifying the faith.

item.title: Truly Converted to the Gospel of Jesus Christ
item.description: (4 Nephi 1:1–19) Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains what conversion truly means. We qualify for eternal life through conversion as we “do” and “become”.

item.title: Jesus and His Prophets
item.description: (4 Nephi 1) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin gives an example of the importance of following our leaders.

item.title: We Are the Covenant People of the Lord
item.description: (3 Nephi 28:30) Elder Russell M. Nelson explains some of the blessings of the Abrahamic covenant and that we are among the covenant people of the Lord.

item.title: The Coming Forth of the Book of Mormon Signaled the Beginning of the Gathering of Israel
item.description: (3 Nephi 29:1–2) President Ezra Taft Benson teaches the value of the Book of Mormon as a tool in converting the world to the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: What Manner of Men Ought Ye to Be?
item.description: (3 Nephi 27:27) President James E. Faust speaks about what kind of people we should be to be good disciples.

item.title: Gospel Is Good News
item.description: (3 Nephi 27:13–22) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how the word gospel means good news and refers to Jesus Christ.

item.title: Tell Us the Name Whereby We Shall Call This Church
item.description: (3 Nephi 27:3–8) President Gordon B. Hinckley talks about what it means to take upon us the name of Christ. Be faithful in fulfilling the duties and responsibilities in your sphere of responsibility.

item.title: Too Sacred to Discuss
item.description: (3 Nephi 26:13–21) President Boyd K. Packer speaks of the importance of not talking about sacred experiences.

item.title: Additional Scriptures
item.description: (3 Nephi 26:9–10) Elder Neal A. Maxwell explains that by giving heed to what the Lord has revealed, we prepare to receive greater revelation.

item.title: Our Obedience to Gospel Principles Helps us Prepare for the Second Coming of Jesus Christ
item.description: (3 Nephi 25:6) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about Elijah.

item.title: No Weapon that is Formed Against Thee Shall Prosper
item.description: (3 Nephi 22:17) President Gordon B. Hinckley testifies that those who oppose God’s work will not prevail. The righteous will press forward amid the opposition.

item.title: Jesus Wants Us to Succeed
item.description: (3 Nephi 22:6–10) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf explains why Jesus wants us to succeed.

item.title: The Book of Mormon Gathers Scattered Israel
item.description: (3 Nephi 21:1–7) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how the Book of Mormon gathers scattered Israel.

item.title: Who is the Seed of Abraham?
item.description: (3 Nephi 20:24–29) President James E. Faust talks about what it means to be the seed of Abraham.

item.title: We Can Have His Light
item.description: (3 Nephi 19:16–36) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about how we can have God’s light through the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Pray in Your Families
item.description: (3 Nephi 18:13–25) President James E. Faust talks about the importance of praying in your families.

item.title: Church Members should Extend Fellowship to All People, 1
item.description: (3 Nephi 18:22-32) Elder M. Russell Ballard explains the urgency of retaining new converts

item.title: Partake of the Sacrament
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks about the sacrament prayers.

item.title: Jesus Blessed the Children “One by One”
item.description: (3 Nephi 17:14–25) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland talks about how Jesus blessed the children and prayed for them.

item.title: God’s Laws Bless His Children
item.description: (3 Nephi 15:1–10) Elder L. Tom Perry testifies that God’s laws govern and bless His children. (“We Believe All That God Has Revealed,” Ensign, Nov. 2003, 85–88.)

item.title: The Golden Rule
item.description: (3 Nephi 14:12) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how the golden rule encompasses the moral code.

item.title: God Forgive Us as We Forgive Others
item.description: (3 Nephi 13:11, 14–15) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches of extending and receiving forgiveness.

item.title: Be Ye Therefore Perfect
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:48) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin speaks of the charge to become perfect like the Savior.

item.title: Going the Extra Mile
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:38–42) President James E. Faust teaches that some of the most rewarding times of our lives are from going the extra mile.

item.title: Salt of the Earth
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:13) Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains that being the salt of the earth is our covenant duty.

item.title: Salt of the Earth
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:13) Elder Carlos E. Asay tells how men might lose their “savor” as priesthood holders. He shares guidelines to help maintain spiritual strength in the priesthood. (“Salt of the Earth: Savor of Men and Saviors of Men,” Ensign, May 1980.)

item.title: Covenants and Ordinances
item.description: (3 Nephi 11:14–17) Elder David A. Bednar explains that we come unto Christ through covenants and ordinances.

item.title: Christ Brings Light Where There Is Darkness
item.description: (3 Nephi 10:9–13) Elder Robert D. Hales testifies of the comfort the gospel brings.

item.title: A Change in the Commandment to Sacrifice
item.description: (3 Nephi 9:20) Elder D. Todd Christofferson teaches that the sacrifice the Lord accepts is the gift of yourself—a broken heart and a contrite spirit.

item.title: The Devil Rejoices When We Sin
item.description: (3 Nephi 9:2, 13–15) Elder Robert D. Hales explains that the devil never has joy unless we sin; it is our sins that make him laugh.

item.title: True Conversion
item.description: (3 Nephi 7:21–26) Elder Richard G. Scott tells what conversion is and how it can lead to aligning our views to the Lord’s. He teaches how to become truly converted.

item.title: Pride Is Enmity
item.description: (3 Nephi 6:10–18) President Gordon B. Hinckley reads a message by President Ezra Taft Benson about the danger of pride.

item.title: A Living Sacrifice
item.description: (3 Nephi 2:1–3) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about a living sacrifice.

item.title: Chapter 1: How We Got the Book of Mormon
item.description: Joseph Smith sees a vision of God and Jesus Christ. An angel, Moroni, instructs him and shows him where to find an ancient record. Joseph translates the record by the power of God.

item.title: Chapter 2: Lehi Warns the People
item.description: Lehi warns the people of Jerusalem to repent or they will soon be destroyed. The people are angry with Lehi and try to kill him.

item.title: Chapter 3: Lehi Leaves Jerusalem
item.description: The Lord warns Lehi to flee with his family into the wilderness. Lehi's son, Nephi, prays and believes his father's words but his two other brothers, Laman and Lemuel, rebel.

item.title: Chapter 4: The Brass Plates
item.description: Lehi sends his sons back to Jerusalem to get the brass plates from King Laban. After many attempts they are able to get the plates and, Zoram, one of Laban's servants, comes with them.

item.title: Chapter 5: Traveling in the Wilderness
item.description: Ishmael and his family join Lehi's family in the wilderness. The sons of Lehi marry the daughters of Ishmael. They have many trials in the wilderness, and some of them rebel. They reach the seashore and name the land Bountiful.

item.title: Chapter 6: LehiΓÇÖs Dream
item.description: Lehi shares a dream he had with his family. In his dream he saw a tree with fruit that would make you happy. Various groups of people either partake of the fruit, get lost on their way to the tree, or mock those who partake of the fruit.

item.title: Chapter 7: Building the Ship
item.description: The Lord instructs Nephi to build a ship and reveals to Nephi the design and method for making the ship. Laman and Lemuel mock Nephi for attempting to build a ship.

item.title: Chapter 8: Crossing the Sea
item.description: Lehi and his family set off in the ship for the promised land. Laman and Lemuel become angry and tie Nephi up with ropes. A storm arises and does not subside until Laman and Lemuel untie Nephi.

item.title: Chapter 9: A New Home in the Promised Land
item.description: Lehi and his family arrive in the promised land. The Lord commands Nephi to keep a record. After Lehi dies, Laman and Lemuel rebel and their families separate themselves from those who follow Nephi.

item.title: Chapter 10: Jacob and Sherem
item.description: Nephi dies, and his brother Jacob becomes the leader. A wicked man named Sherem tells people not to believe in Christ. Jacob speaks with Sherem, ands after a sign from God, Sherem repents and tells the people to believe in Christ.

item.title: Chapter 11: Enos
item.description: Jacob's son Enos prays all day and into the night, and his sins are forgiven. He prays for the Nephites and the Lamanites. Enos spends the rest of his life serving God and teaching people the gospel.

item.title: Chapter 12: King Benjamin
item.description: King Benjamin addresses his people and prophesies about the life of Jesus Christ. The people believe his teachings and covenant to keep the commandments. King Benjamin's son Mosiah is appointed to be the next king.

item.title: Chapter 13: Zeniff
item.description: The Lamanites allow Zeniff and his people to live in their land. The Lamanites agree to not attack, but they do not honor their promise. The Nephites pray for strength. They are able to defeat the Lamanites for two generations.

item.title: Chapter 14: Abinadi and King Noah
item.description: Abinadi teaches wicked King Noah and his priests. King Noah becomes angry and has Abinadi killed. Alma, one of King NoahΓÇÖs priests, believes Abinadi and flees.

item.title: Chapter 15: Alma Teaches and Baptizes
item.description: Alma writes down the words of Abinadi and preaches the gospel to the Nephites. Many people follow him and are baptized. The army of King Noah comes looking for them, but they escape and establish a righteous civilization.

item.title: Chapter 16: King Limhi and His People Escape
item.description: Limhi becomes the king of the Nephites who were captured by the Lamanites. Ammon and other Nephites arrive from Zarahemla and help King Limhi's people to escape and return to Zarahemla.

item.title: Chapter 17: Alma and His People Escape
item.description: Lamanites take over the land of Alma and his people. They pray to God to be freed. God strengthens them and prepares a way for them to escape. They make it to Zarahemla and are welcomed by King Mosiah and his people.

item.title: Chapter 18: Alma the Younger Repents
item.description: Alma becomes the leader of the Church. His son Alma the Younger and the sons of Mosiah persecute the followers of Christ. An angel appears to them and calls them to repentance. They repent and try to repair the evil they did.

item.title: Chapter 19: The Sons of Mosiah Become Missionaries
item.description: The four sons of Mosiah desire to preach the gospel among the Lamanites. They all refuse to be king. King Mosiah prays, and the Lord tells him to let his sons go. They fast and pray that they will be good missionaries.

item.title: Chapter 20: Alma and Nehor
item.description: Alma the Younger becomes the first chief judge. A wicked man named Nehor leads many away with his lies and kills Gideon. Nehor is put to death, but many still believe his words. Those who continue to follow God and care for the poor are blessed.

item.title: Chapter 21: The Amlicites
item.description: Amlici, a wicked Nephite, wants to become king, and many follow him. The people vote, and he is not made king. He and his followers fight against the righteous Nephites. The Nephites are blessed with strength and defeat the Amlicites.

item.title: Chapter 22: AlmaΓÇÖs Mission to Ammonihah
item.description: Alma steps down as chief judge to spread the gospel. Alma finds Amulek, and they preach together. Zeezrom tries to confound them but is unable to do so. Zeezrom and others repent and are baptized. The believers are persecuted.

item.title: Chapter 23: Ammon: A Great Servant
item.description: Ammon becomes a servant of King Lamoni. He defends the kingΓÇÖs flock from a band of robbers. King Lamoni is impressed with AmmonΓÇÖs faithfulness. Ammon teaches King Lamoni, and he is converted.

item.title: Chapter 24: Ammon Meets King LamoniΓÇÖs Father
item.description: Ammon and King Lamoni go to rescue Aaron out of prison. They meet King LamoniΓÇÖs father on the way. At first, his father is very angry, but his heart is softened and he helps free Aaron from prison.

item.title: Chapter 25: Aaron Teaches King LamoniΓÇÖs Father
item.description: Aaron goes to the land of King Lamoni's father and teaches him the gospel. He is converted, and many believe him.

item.title: Chapter 26: The People of Ammon
item.description: The sons of Mosiah teach many Lamanites who repent and join the Church. They become known as the Anti-Nephi-Lehies. They are hard-working people who make a promise to God that they will never kill again.

item.title: Chapter 27: Korihor
item.description: Korihor preaches wickedness. Many people believe Korihor and are led astray. He demands a sign from Alma. Korihor is struck dumb by the Lord.

item.title: Chapter 28: The Zoramites and the Rameumptom
item.description: Alma and Amulek find success among the poor Zoramites. They teach them about faith, Jesus Christ, and God's plan for His children.

item.title: Chapter 29: Alma Teaches about Faith and the Word of God
item.description: Alma teaches the Zoramites about faith. He says that faith is believing something that is true but that cannot be seen. He teaches that if you continue to study the gospel, your faith will become stronger.

item.title: Chapter 30: Alma Counsels His Sons
item.description: Alma counsels with his three sons. He commends Helaman and Shiblon for their faith, but he chastises Corianton for breaking the commandments and setting a bad example for the Zoramites. Alma and his sons continue to preach the gospel.

item.title: Chapter 31: Captain Moroni Defeats Zerahemnah
item.description: Zerahemnah, the leader of the Lamanites, brings his army to fight the Nephites. Captain Moroni's army is well prepared and battle against the Lamanites.

item.title: Chapter 32: Captain Moroni and the Title of Liberty
item.description: A wicked man named Amalickiah wants to be king over the Nephites. Many Nephites leave the Church and follow him. Captain Moroni erects the title of liberty and encourages the Nephites to protect their freedom.

item.title: Chapter 33: King-Men versus Freemen
item.description: The Nephites in favor of a king refuse to help fight with Captain Moroni against the Lamanites.

item.title: Chapter 34: Helaman and the 2,000 Young Warriors
item.description: The Nephite leaders don't want the people of Ammon to break their promise and help fight against the Lamanites. Their sons decide to fight. Helaman leads the 2,000 sons to battle. None are killed, because of their great faith.

item.title: Chapter 35: Captain Moroni and Pahoran
item.description: Chapter 35: Captain Moroni and Pahoran Captain Moroni writes to Pahoran asking for more soldiers and supplies to help Helaman and his army. Pahoran is unable to send help, however, because a group of wicked Nephites has joined with the Lamanites.

item.title: Chapter 36: Hagoth
item.description: Hagoth and a group of Nephites leave Zarahemla and travel north. They built ships and set sail. They took food and supplies and were never heard from again.

item.title: Chapter 37: Nephi and Lehi in Prison
item.description: Nephi and Lehi, the sons of Helaman, preach the gospel among the Lamanites. They are thrown into prison but escape by a ring of fire.

item.title: Chapter 38: The Murder of the Chief Judge
item.description: Nephi prophesies about the chief judgeΓÇÖs murder. Many people are convinced that Nephi is a prophet.

item.title: Chapter 39: Nephi Receives Great Power
item.description: Nephi is saddened by the wickedness of the Nephites. He prays for a famine to humble them.

item.title: Chapter 40: Samuel the Lamanite Tells about Jesus Christ
item.description: The Lord sends Samuel, a Lamanite prophet, among the Nephites. He prophesies of the signs of ChristΓÇÖs birth and death.

item.title: Chapter 41: The Signs of ChristΓÇÖs Birth
item.description: The unbelieving Nephites appoint a day when they will kill the believers if the sign of ChristΓÇÖs birth has not appeared. Nephi, the son of Nephi, prays in behalf of the believers. The Lord comforts Nephi, and the sign appears the next day.

item.title: Chapter 42: The Signs of ChristΓÇÖs Crucifixion
item.description: Great storms, thunderings, and earthquakes arise after the death of Christ. There is darkness for three days, and out of the darkness the survivors hear the voice of Jesus Christ calling them to repentance.

item.title: Chapter 43: Jesus Christ Appears to the Nephites
item.description: Christ descends out of heaven. He speaks to the people gathered at the temple and teaches them about baptism. He calls Twelve Apostles .

item.title: Chapter 44: Jesus Christ Blesses the Children
item.description: Christ tells the Nephites to bring their children to him. He offers a prayer that is so marvelous that the words of it could not be written. Christ blesses the children one by one, and they are surrounded and ministered to by angels from heaven.

item.title: Chapter 45: Jesus Christ Teaches about the Sacrament and Prayer
item.description: Christ demonstrates and explains the sacrament. He teaches the people to pray always in his name. He gives the twelve disciples the power to give others the Holy Ghost. The disciples witness Christ ascending to heaven.

item.title: Chapter 46: Jesus Christ Teaches and Prays with the Nephites
item.description: Angels minister to those who were baptized, and Christ appears again. Christ prays to Heavenly Father. He gives the people the sacrament. After Jesus returns to heaven, his disciples teach and baptize many more people.

item.title: Chapter 47: Jesus Christ Blesses His Disciples
item.description: Christ comes to the twelve disciples when they are fasting and praying. He teaches them the gospel and tells them to write down his words. He promises each of the Twelve distinct blessings.

item.title: Chapter 48: Peace in America
item.description: After Jesus returns to live with Heavenly Father, the people are blessed. Many more people are baptized, and there is peace in the land.

item.title: Chapter 49: Mormon and His Teachings
item.description: Many years after Jesus visited the Nephites, Mormon becomes responsible for the sacred records of the people. The people are very wicked. Mormon leads the people into battle, but because of their wickedness, all people are destroyed.

item.title: Chapter 50: The Jaredites Leave Babel
item.description: During the destruction of the Tower of Babel, the Lord spares the languages of JaredΓÇÖs family. They gather supplies and go where the Lord directs.

item.title: Chapter 51: The Jaredites Travel to the Promised Land
item.description: The Jaredites build barges according to the LordΓÇÖs instructions. The brother of Jared asks the Lord to touch stones to provide light in the barges. He sees the Lord. The Jaredites travel to the promised land.

item.title: Chapter 52: The Destruction of the Jaredites
item.description: The wicked Jaredites try to kill the prophets and have many wars. The prophet Ether warns the wicked King Coriantumr about the destruction of his people. Eventually, all people are destroyed. Ether records the history of the Jaredites.

item.title: Chapter 53: Moroni and His Teachings
item.description: After Mormon dies, Moroni writes important doctrine about the sacrament, baptism, and the Savior. The wicked Lamanites kill Nephites who would not deny Jesus Christ. Moroni knew he would return to live with Heavenly Father when he died.

item.title: Chapter 54: The Promise of the Book of Mormon
item.description: Before Moroni buried the plates, he wrote a promise that if people would ask sincerely if the records were true, the Holy Ghost would testify of the truth. He hid the plates in the Hill Cumorah.

item.title: My Joy Is Full
item.description: Visual and music highlight this portrayal of the Savior's visit to the inhabitants of ancient America, providing a unique view of His caring, compassion, and love for His children.

item.title: Becoming Children of Christ
item.description: Two young women learn what it means to put off the natural man and become children of Christ.

item.title: Firm in the Faith of Christ
item.description: A grandfather uses Captain Moroni as an example of a true hero for his grandson. Moroni's faith and loyalty to the Savior provide an example all Saints should follow.

item.title: O Ye Fair Ones
item.description: As Mormon and his son Moroni behold the hundreds of thousands of Nephites slain in the last battle with the Lamanites, Mormon laments, "O ye fair ones, how could ye have departed from the ways of the Lord!"

item.title: The Mediator
item.description: A portrayal of the analogy Elder Boyd K. Packer used in his April 1977 general conference address. A young man who fails to pay a debt is saved from the grasp of justice through the mediation of a friend.

item.title: Spiritual Crocodiles
item.description: A portrayal of the analogy Elder Boyd K. Packer used in his April 1976 general conference address. Just as well-camouflaged crocodiles prey on unwary victims, Satan preys on unwary youth by using tactics that camouflage the deadly nature of sin.

item.title: The Pride Cycle
item.description: An illustration of the great pride of the people of Zarahemla about twenty years before the birth of the Savior. The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the people's wickedness.

item.title: Can You Imagine?
item.description: A young man's alter ego uses a courtroom setting to explore what it would be like to stand before God on Judgment Day.

item.title: Nothing Accidental or Spontaneous
item.description: A video explaining that God's creations are made with a purpose.

item.title: Skiing Expedition
item.description: (Number 12) A young man learns the importance of trusting an experienced guide as they ski down a mountain.

item.title: Separating Ourselves from the World
item.description: (Numbers 6:1-21) Elder Hales teaches church members to be in the world but not of the world.

item.title: Cling to Gods Values
item.description: (Numbers 6:1-21) President Hinckley encourages saints to cling to God's values.

item.title: Windows of Personal Revelation
item.description: (Leviticus 11:1-45) Elder Worthlin teaches that if we keep our bodies pure and obey the Word of Wisdom the windows of revelation will be open unto us.

item.title: Sacrifice and Sacrament
item.description: (Leviticus 1-7) A man goes back in time to teach his younger self about the purposes of sacrifice and sacrament. By understanding the symbolism of animal sacrifice in the Old Testament, we come to realize its similarity to the sacrament—to remember the Savior and to commit ourselves to him.

item.title: Real, Personal Sacrifice
item.description: (Exodus 29:15-18) Elder Maxwell teaches the importance of sacrifice.

item.title: How a Priesthood Bearer Should Dress
item.description: (Exodus 28:2-4) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland gives a suggestion on how priesthood bearers should dress.

item.title: The Power and Authority of God
item.description: (Exodus 28:1) President Faust explains the power of the priesthood and encourages priesthood holders to live worthily of its power.

item.title: The Tabernacle
item.description: (Exodus 25-30) A video explaining the Tabernacle and its importance.

item.title: Peculiar People
item.description: (Exodus 19:3-8) Elder Russell M. Nelson explains the meaning of peculiar people.

item.title: Sin of Murmuring
item.description: (Exodus 15:22-27) Elder Maxwell explains that murmuring is a sin of the natural man.

item.title: Sacrament of the Lords Supper
item.description: (Exodus 12:1-28) Elder L. Tom Perry explains the importance of the Lord's supper.

item.title: The Passover
item.description: (Exodus 12) A short video explaining the meaning of the Passover and it's significance.

item.title: Reverence Invites Revelation
item.description: (Exodus 3:1-10) President Boyd K. Packer teaches that reverence invites the spirit of revelation.

item.title: A Seer Will I Raise Up
item.description: (JST, Genesis 50) Joseph Smith is prepared to bring to pass the restoration of the Gospel.

item.title: Declaration of Lineage in Patriarchal Blessings
item.description: (Genesis 49) President Faust explains the declaration of lineage and why it is in the Patriarchal blessing.

item.title: A Sacred Guideline
item.description: (Genesis 49) President Faust explains how the Patriarchal blessings is a sacred guideline.

item.title: Our Own Liahona
item.description: (Genesis 49) President Monson explains how Patriarchal blessings can be our own Liahona.

item.title: Priesthood Blessings
item.description: (Genesis 48:14-20) Elder Oaks teaches the significance of a priesthood blessing.

item.title: Sin Results in Suffering
item.description: Elder Ballard speaks on the suffering that sin can bring to our lives (Genesis 42:3-24).

item.title: Temporal Preparation
item.description: (Genesis 40) President Hinckley encourages church members to be prepared for future calamities.

item.title: Joseph in Egypt
item.description: (Genesis 39:1-20) President Benson teaches church members to choose God first.

item.title: Shun Immorality
item.description: (Genesis 39:1-20) President Hinckley encourages church members to avoid the immorality we have in the world today.

item.title: For God Did Send Me
item.description: (Genesis 37-41) President Gordon B. Hinckley teaches to hold the God's standards high and be an example to the world.

item.title: Many Esaus
item.description: (Genesis 25:24-34) Elder Oaks teaches to seek spiritual things before worldly things.

item.title: Thousands of Millions
item.description: (Genesis 24:1-4,60) A video teaching that the choices we make in this life can affect the generations to come.

item.title: Akedah (The Binding)
item.description: (Genesis 22:1-18) A video of Abraham offering his son Isaac as a sacrifice unto the Lord.

item.title: Gliding Naively through Life
item.description: (Genesis 22:1-14) Elder Maxwell teaches that we need to experience challenges in our lives.

item.title: Covenants and Ordinances
item.description: (Genesis 17:1-9) Elder Nelson teaches about the importance of covenants.

item.title: Abraham
item.description: (Genesis 17) The Lord appears to Abraham and covenants with him.

item.title: Things of the World
item.description: (Genesis 13:1-13) Elder Scott teaches to eliminate distractions from our lives.

item.title: The Abrahamic Covenant
item.description: (Genesis 12:1-3; Abraham 2:9-11) One family shows love and service to another less fortunate family.

item.title: Deliverance of Abraham
item.description: (Abraham 1:1-20) The Lord hears the prayer of Abraham and delivers him from his enemies.

item.title: Generous Fast Offerings
item.description: (Abraham 1:1-20) Elder Wirthlin encourages church members to give generous fast offerings.

item.title: Put God First
item.description: (Moses 7:18) President Benson teaches church members to put God first in their lives.

item.title: First Principles and Ordinances
item.description: (Moses 6:58-62) A video describes the importance of the atonement in our lives due to the fall of Adam and Eve.

item.title: Books of Remembrance
item.description: (Moses 6:5) President Kimball speaks on the importance of journals.

item.title: Are We Our Brother's Keeper?
item.description: (Moses 5:32-34) Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains why we must be our brother's keeper.

item.title: Salvation through Christ
item.description: (Moses 4:14-25) President Benson teaches that salvation is only through Christ.

item.title: Evidence of Creation
item.description: (Moses 2:26-31) Elder Ballard teaches that there is evidence of the creation all around us.

item.title: Christ the Creator
item.description: (Moses 2:1) Elder Maxwell testifies that Christ is the creator of our world and our savior.

item.title: The Creation
item.description: (Genesis 1; Moses 2) Elder Nelson explains the creation and its importance.

item.title: Gods Work and Glory
item.description: (Moses 1:39) A video explains the importance of symbols and why they are used in the scriptures.

item.title: I've Got to Find Out Who I Am
item.description: (Moses 1:10-22) A song about finding out who we are.

item.title: A Child of God
item.description: (Moses 1:1-22) Elder Oaks teaches that we are all children of God.

item.title: I Am a Son of God
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland Narrates a depiction of the story of Moses

item.title: God Has Held You in Reserve
item.description: (Abraham 3:22-28) Elder Marvin J. Ashton teaches about the last generation of righteous church members.

item.title: Children of Israel
item.description: Primary children talk about their faith and the gospel.

item.title: Many Plain and Precious Things
item.description: A video explaining the importance of the Joseph Smith translation of the bible.

item.title: Time Capsule
item.description: Seminary students reflect their opinions on the Old Testament and show their excitement to study it.

item.title: The Importance of the Old Testament
item.description: President Packer lists the doctrines and principles taught in the Old Testament.

item.title: The Atonement
item.description: (Moses 5:5-9) A video explaining the atonement and our potential.

item.title: Josiah and the Book of the Law
item.description: (2 Kings 22-23) King Josiah motivates his kingdom to repent from their wicked ways by reading from the Book of the Law.

item.title: For Such a Time as This
item.description: (Esther 1-4) Showing her faith, Esther demonstrates courage by standing up for the Jews.

item.title: To Look Upon
item.description: (2 Samuel 11) Elder Dallin H. Oaks relates the story of King David to illustrate the dangers of pornography. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Worldly Pleasures
item.description: (Ecclesiastes 1-2) Elder Perry encourages church members to seek of the things of the spirit and not those of the world.

item.title: Parachutes
item.description: (Proverbs 3:5-6) A video describing the importance of following instructions.

item.title: I Am Clean
item.description: (Psalms 24:3-4) President Hinckley relates a dream that was had by President Joseph F. Smith.

item.title: Singing Hymns
item.description: (Psalms) Elder Dallin H. Oaks teaches the importance of singing Hymns.

item.title: Faith and Trials
item.description: (Job 42:10-17) Elder Hales teaches to show faith during trials.

item.title: Support through Trials
item.description: (Job 1-23) Elder Scott teaches that we will grow stronger and the Lord will bless us as we pass through trials.

item.title: When All Is Said and Done
item.description: (Esther 1-6) A song about the life of Esther.

item.title: Worldwide Access to Temples
item.description: (Ezra 1-6) President Hinckley expresses his desire that a temple be built in close distance to all latter-day saints.

item.title: Temples Are Built by Faith and Sacrifice
item.description: (2 Chronicles 1-7) President Monson teaches that temples are built by the sacrifices of members of the church.

item.title: Eyewitness News at Six (586 BC)
item.description: (2 Kings 24-25) A news team gives report of the destruction of Jerusalem.

item.title: Eyewitness News at Six (600 BC)
item.description: (2 Kings 24-25) A news team gives updates on life in 600 BC.

item.title: One Voice
item.description: (2 Kings 22-23) A song about the strength of one voice for righteousness.

item.title: Pride
item.description: (2 Kings 5:1-19) Elder Ballard tells the story of Naaman and relates it to pride.

item.title: Obedience
item.description: (2 Kings 5:1-14) President Benson teaches obedience and that we should love the Lord.

item.title: Naaman and Elisha
item.description: (2 Kings 5:1-14) Naaman is healed by following the prophets counsel.

item.title: Spirit Whispers
item.description: (1 Kings 19:11-13) President Eyring teaches that the Spirit will bear testimony if we listen.

item.title: Still, Small Voice
item.description: (1 Kings 19:11-13) President Packer lists the doctrines and principles taught in the Old Testament.

item.title: Elijah and the Widow of Zarephath
item.description: (1 Kings 17) During a time of famine, the prophet Elijah rewards the faith of Zarephath with food.

item.title: Temple Ordinances Are Crucial
item.description: (1 Kings 6) President Hunter explains the importance of temple attendance.

item.title: Blessings of Repentance
item.description: (2 Samuel 13-22) Elder Scott teaches the wonderful blessing of repentance.

item.title: True Friend
item.description: (1 Samuel 18-23) President Eyring explains the importance of having a true friend.

item.title: The Lord Will Deliver Me
item.description: (1 Samuel 17) Elder Oaks tells the story of David and Goliath.

item.title: Measure of Our Hearts
item.description: (1 Samuel 16:1-13) Elder Marvin J. Ashton explains how the Lord measures our hearts.

item.title: Choose to Be Humble
item.description: (1 Samuel 15:10-35) President Hinckley encourages church member to choose to be humble.

item.title: Whom the Lord Calls
item.description: (1 Samuel 10) President Monson teaches "whom the Lord calls, the Lord qualifies."

item.title: Samuel and Eli
item.description: (1 Samuel 3:1-10) Samuel hears the voice of Lord.

item.title: For This Child I Prayed
item.description: (1 Samuel 1:1-10) A young woman ponders the decision of having a family and its importance.

item.title: Hannah's Faith
item.description: (1 Samuel 1) Hannah prays to the Lord to bless her with a son.

item.title: God Helps Ordinary People
item.description: (Judges 6-7) President Faust relates the story of Gideon from the Bible, explaining that the Lord can do remarkable things through a person with ordinary faith.

item.title: Parents Choices Affect Children
item.description: (Judges 2) Elder Maxwell teaches that choices made by parents have large effects on their children.

item.title: Full Commitment
item.description: (Joshua 24:15) President Hunter speaks on Joshua's commitment to following the commandments of the Lord.

item.title: No Other Gods before Me
item.description: (Joshua 23-24) A young man relates the dangers of carbon monoxide to that of Idolatry.

item.title: The Incomparable Atonement
item.description: (Isaiah 53) President Faust explains the importance of the Atonement and encourages church members to learn more about it.

item.title: Daniel in the Lions' Den
item.description: (Daniel 6) The Lord delivers Daniel from the lion's den.

item.title: The Sealing Power
item.description: (Malachi 4:5-6) A woman bears testimony of the sealing powers of the priesthood.

item.title: Paying Tithing
item.description: (Malachi 3:8-12) Elder Oaks explains the importance of paying tithing.

item.title: God Reveals His Secrets
item.description: (Amos 3:7) A video depicting how God has spoken to his prophets.

item.title: No Light without Prophets
item.description: (Amos 3:3-8) Elder Mark E. Peterson explains the importance of prophets.

item.title: The Gardener
item.description: (Joel 2) A gardener anxiously awaits the return of the housemaster.

item.title: Piano Recital
item.description: (Joel 2) A young man learns the importance of practice and to avoid procrastination.

item.title: Move This Work Forward
item.description: (Daniel 2:31-45) President Hinckley encourages church members to lead by example and move the work of the Lord forward.

item.title: Revelation Is among Us
item.description: (Daniel 2) President Hinckley declares that God still speaks to his holy prophets.

item.title: Ezekiels Prophecy Fulfilled
item.description: (Ezekiel 37:15-17) President Packer explains Ezekiel's prophecy and how it has been fulfilled.

item.title: Watchman on the Tower
item.description: (Ezekiel 33:1-7) The Lord calls prophets to be the "watchmen" on the tower.

item.title: Lord Works from Inside Out
item.description: President Benson teaches that the Lord works from the inside out (Ezekiel 18:21-24).

item.title: Stand a Little Taller
item.description: President Hinckley challenges church members to stand a little taller (Ezekiel 5-15).

item.title: We Should Honor and Keep Covenants
item.description: President Faust teaches the importance of keeping covenants (Jeremiah 31:31-34).

item.title: Blessings of Following Prophets
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry teaches obedience to the prophet yields blessings (Jeremiah 27-28).

item.title: Following the Prophet
item.description: (Jeremiah 20-21) President Eyring speaks on the importance of listening to the prophet.

item.title: Sisters Are Not Obligated to Serve Missions
item.description: (Jeremiah 16:14-16) President Hinckley declares that sisters are not obligated to serve missions.

item.title: Need for Greatest Generation of Missionaries
item.description: (Jeremiah 16:14-16) Elder Ballard speaks on the standard of missionary service, and encourages young men to live worthily to serve missions.

item.title: Fishers and Hunters
item.description: (Jeremiah 16:14-16) Missionary work is a vital part in the growth of the church.

item.title: Gathering of Israel
item.description: (Jeremiah 16:14-16) A video depicting the growth of missionary work in the church.

item.title: Arabian Horse
item.description: (Jeremiah 11:4) A video shows how an Arabian horse is trained to be totally obedient.

item.title: On the Lord's Errand
item.description: (Jeremiah 1:4-10) President Monson declares "When we are on the Lord's errand we are entitled to the Lord's help."

item.title: Wherefore Have We Fasted
item.description: (Isaiah 58) A young man recounts a lesson learned from his youth.

item.title: Come unto Christ
item.description: (Isaiah 55:1-7) Elder Holland gives the invitation to come unto Christ.

item.title: Bring Back Those Who Are Lost
item.description: (Isaiah 54:1-3) President Hinckley encourages church members to bring back those who are lost.

item.title: Isaiah Prophesied of Christ
item.description: (Isaiah 53) A video telling of Isaiah's writings of the Savior.

item.title: A Marvelous Work and a Wonder
item.description: (Isaiah 29:4-14) The story of Joseph Smith and his translation of the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Perilous Times
item.description: (Isaiah 24) President Hinckley teaches that despite the perilous times that we live in we can all have peace in our lives by living the gospel.

item.title: Following Prophetic Counsel
item.description: (Isaiah 1-12) Elder Ballard declares there is safety in following the prophets counsel.

item.title: Chapter 1: Before the Old Testament
item.description: We lived in heaven with Heavenly Father before this life. We had spirit bodies. We came to this earth to be tested in order to return to live with Him again. It is only through Jesus Christ's Atonement that we can return to live with God.

item.title: Chapter 2: Jesus Makes the Earth
item.description: Under the direction of Heavenly Father, Jesus Christ makes the earth.

item.title: Chapter 3: Adam and Eve
item.description: Adam and Eve live in the Garden of Eden. God tells them that they cannot eat of the tree of good and evil and remain in the garden. Satan tempts them to eat the fruit. God casts them out of the garden.

item.title: Chapter 4: Adam and His Family
item.description: Adam and Eve have many children. Cain kills Abel, and God punishes him for this sin.

item.title: Chapter 5: Enoch
item.description: The Lord takes up Enoch and his righteous people. Enoch sees many great things in a vision.

item.title: Chapter 6: Noah
item.description: Noah warns the people of their wickedness. He prophesies of a flood. They reject his words. Noah and his family are spared in the ark.

item.title: Chapter 7: The Tower of Babel
item.description: People build the tower of Babel to try to reach God in heaven. God changes their languages. God spares Jared and his family.

item.title: Chapter 9: Abraham and the Sacrifice of Isaac
item.description: God commands Abraham to sacrifice his son Isaac. Abraham shows his obedience to the Lord, but an angel tells him to stop. The Lord provides a ram for the sacrifice.

item.title: Chapter 10: Jacob and Esau
item.description: Isaac and Rebekah have twin boys, Jacob and Esau. Esau gives his birthright blessing to Jacob in exchange for some pottage.

item.title: Chapter 11: Jacob and His Family
item.description: Jacob finds Rachel and Leah, and they have numerous children in Canaan, the promised land.

item.title: Chapter 12: Joseph
item.description: Joseph is his father's favorite son. His brothers become very jealous. They sell him as a slave into Egypt.

item.title: Chapter 13: Joseph in Egypt
item.description: Joseph is sold as a slave in Egypt. He becomes an adviser to the king because of his righteousness.

item.title: Chapter 14: JosephΓÇÖs Brothers in Egypt
item.description: Joseph reunites with his father and brothers and provides food and land for them.

item.title: Chapter 15: The Baby Moses
item.description: The king of Egypt orders all Israelite baby boys to be put to death. The baby Moses is spared by the daughter of the king.

item.title: Chapter 16: The Prophet Moses
item.description: Moses leaves Egypt. He sees the burning bush, and he hears the voice of Jesus Christ. He gives the king in Egypt many warnings to release the Israelites.

item.title: Chapter 17: The Passover
item.description: The Israelites put lamb's blood over their doors, and their children are spared from a terrible sickness. The Lord helps Moses and the Israelites flee Egypt by parting the Red Sea.

item.title: Chapter 18: The Israelites in the Wilderness
item.description: God provides manna and water for the Israelites in the wilderness.

item.title: Chapter 19: The Ten Commandments
item.description: Jesus Christ declares the Ten Commandments to the people on Mount Sinai.

item.title: Chapter 20: The Golden Calf
item.description: The Israelites worship idols instead of Jesus Christ. Moses receives the Ten Commandments and prophesies that the wicked will be destroyed.

item.title: Chapter 21: The Tabernacle
item.description: Moses tells the Israelites to build a tabernacle according to Jesus Christ's instructions. Jesus Christ promises to visit the tabernacle.

item.title: Chapter 22: Forty Years in the Wilderness
item.description: The Israelites travel for 40 years in the wilderness in search of the promised land.

item.title: Chapter 23: Joshua
item.description: Joshua becomes the prophet after Moses. Joshua parts the water so the Israelites can travel on dry ground. He leads the Israelites and marches around the walls of Jericho.

item.title: Chapter 24: Ruth and Naomi
item.description: Ruth takes care of Naomi, her mother-in-law, after Ruth's husband dies. Ruth is blessed with a righteous husband because of her love for and care of Naomi.

item.title: Chapter 25: Samuel
item.description: Samuel learns from the priest Eli. Although very young, Samuel is called as a prophet.

item.title: Chapter 26: King Saul
item.description: Saul becomes the king of Israel. Saul disobeys God by performing sacrifices without the prophet Samuel.

item.title: Chapter 27: Young David
item.description: Samuel goes to Bethlehem to find the next king of Israel. God chooses the young David to be the future king.

item.title: Chapter 28: David and Goliath
item.description: Young David defeats Goliath with God's help.

item.title: Chapter 29: King David
item.description: God blesses David and gives him success in many battles. David becomes king of Israel. He is a good king and obeys God's commandments. He lusts after Bathsheba and sins.

item.title: Chapter 30: King Solomon
item.description: God blesses King Solomon with wisdom. Solomon gives many people wise counsel. He advises two women who are arguing over a baby.

item.title: Chapter 31: The Temple
item.description: God tells King Solomon to build a temple. It is made out of the best material. The temple is the house of God.

item.title: Chapter 32: The Divided Kingdom
item.description: Solomon makes sacrifices to idols, and Israel is punished for wickedness. After Solomon dies, the twelve tribes of Israel are divided.

item.title: Chapter 33: The Prophet Elijah
item.description: Elijah hides from wicked King Ahab and Jezebel. He goes to the home of a poor woman and child. The woman prepares bread with their only supplies. The Lord blesses them with food and water during the famine and heals her dead son.

item.title: Chapter 34: Elijah and the Priests of Baal
item.description: Elijah shows the priests of Baal that idols have no power.

item.title: Chapter 35: Elijah Talks with Jesus
item.description: Elijah sees and talks with Jesus Christ. God tells Elijah that Elisha will be the new prophet.

item.title: Chapter 36: Elijah and Elisha
item.description: Elijah parts the Jordan River with his coat. Elijah is taken up into heaven. Elisha becomes the new prophet. He parts the river with Elijah's coat, and they recognize him as a prophet.

item.title: Chapter 37: The Prophet Elisha: Three Miracles
item.description: Elisha performs the miracle of the oil, raises a boy from the dead, and heals Naaman of leprosy.

item.title: Chapter 38: Jonah
item.description: Jonah refuses to warn the people according to the Lord's directions. He is swallowed by a large fish. He repents and declares repentance unto the people of Nineveh.

item.title: Chapter 39: The Israelites Are Captured
item.description: Wicked kings rule in Jerusalem. Prophets warn the people, but they do not listen. Babylon conquers them.

item.title: Chapter 40: Daniel and His Friends
item.description: Daniel and his friends obey God and request healthy food instead of meat and wine.

item.title: Chapter 41: Daniel and the KingΓÇÖs Dream
item.description: Daniel interprets the king's dream. The dream means the gospel will be preached all over the world. Daniel becomes leader over all the land.

item.title: Chapter 42: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego
item.description: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego refuse to pray to an idol. The king throws them into a hot furnace, and God saves them.

item.title: Chapter 43: Daniel and the LionsΓÇÖ Den
item.description: King Darius issues a law to kill all those who pray to God. Daniel continues to pray and is thrown into the lions' den. God saves him from injury.

item.title: Chapter 44: Return to Jerusalem
item.description: The Jews return to Jerusalem and rebuild the temple. Some wicked men try to stop them. The prophets Ezra and Nehemiah give them instructions.

item.title: Chapter 45: Esther
item.description: Esther, a Jew, is chosen as the new queen. Esther saves her people by revealing wicked Haman's plan.

item.title: Chapter 46: Job
item.description: Job is a very righteous man. God knew that Job would remain righteous even if he was tried in all things. Satan could not destroy Job's faith.

item.title: Chapter 47: The Prophets Tell about Jesus
item.description: The prophets preach about Jesus Christ. They tell of His birth, life, death, and resurrection.

item.title: Chapter 48: After the Old Testament
item.description: Many Jews disobey God. Armies from other lands take them captive. Herod becomes the king over the Jews.

item.title: More Blessed to Give Than to Receive
item.description: President Monson tells a story from his youth that taught him it is better to give than receive.

item.title: Death Is Swallowed Up in Christ
item.description: President Uchtdorf testifies of the power of the Atonement and, if we will follow the Savior now, we will have less regrets tomorrow

item.title: God of Comfort
item.description: President Monson tells us that, even when the world is at its darkest, if we turn to the Lord; He will lift and guide us.

item.title: Youth and Family History
item.description: Elder Bednar counsels us to become more engaged in Family History work, so that we may become more involved in the Lord’s work by performing baptisms for the dead.

item.title: Foundation of Apostles and Prophets
item.description: Elder Holland tells us that Apostles and Prophets are meant to bless us all and form foundation stones of the true Church, and all of those are based upon the Redeemer.

item.title: Lively Hope of Resurrection
item.description: Elder Oaks expounds upon the vitality of the resurrection in the Father’s plan, and that because of it we may have hope for a better existence beyond out mortal lives.

item.title: Our bodies are our temples
item.description: Sister Tanner testifies that our bodies are temples, and should be treated as such.

item.title: Judging Others
item.description: Elder Ashton teaches that the Lord measures us by our hearts, not our worldly characteristics.

item.title: Shield of Faith Fashioned at Home
item.description: President Packer teaches that the Shield of Faith is forged in the family circle, and that all participate in its strength.

item.title: Abraham’s Seed
item.description: President Faust explains what it means to be Abraham’s seed, that as a part of that covenant we may also receive the promised blessings if we are faithful

item.title: Taking Pleasure in Infirmities
item.description: Elder Hales teaches that the Lord brings us close to Him by our trials, and that through these trials, we may be purified.

item.title: Pride
item.description: President Uchtdorf explains that pride is "a sin of comparison", and comes from a desire to be admired or envied.

item.title: Witnesses of the Resurrection
item.description: President Monson teaches us that we have our eyewitnesses to the truth of Christ, and that the testimony of prophets gives us assurance that He lives.

item.title: Compassion for Others
item.description: Bishop Edgley tells us that we are blessed to be a part of a church in which we ‘endure together’.

item.title: An High Priest of Good Things to Come
item.description: Elder Holland testifies that, no matter how dark the world may seem, blessings will come for those that have embraced the Gospel of Jesus Christ

item.title: Hebrews 11:1
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar lays out the main elements and doctrines of faith.

item.title: The Future Is as Bright as Your Faith
item.description: President Monson testifies that, even during times when hope seems lost, so long as we have made the Gospel central to our lives and remain steadfast, we will be blessed beyond measure.

item.title: A Conscience Void of Offence
item.description: Elder Nelson asks us if we feel ready for an inspection of our lives by the Lord, and gives examples of men who did feel prepared to meet judgment.

item.title: Testimony of the Resurrection
item.description: President Monson bears his testimony on the actuality of the Father, Christ, and the Atonement.

item.title: Requirements of Salvation
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches that in our cleansing is dependent upon our faith, and goes on to say that those who have been baptized will be finally saved at the end of their lives if they have continued in their covenants.

item.title: Sharing the Gospel
item.description: Elder Cook advises members to become more active in sharing the Gospel with those around them. He tells us that if we do share with others, we will be blessed.

item.title: Selflessness
item.description: Elder Peterson describes the attributes of a truly selfless person and how they are willing to sacrifice for the benefit of others.

item.title: Feelings of Inadequacy
item.description: President Uchtdorf testifies that are things that God has given us to do, and that only we can do them.

item.title: Our Body Is Bought with a Price
item.description: Elder Christofferson tells us that is our duty to God to care for the bodies He has given us.

item.title: Account of Big Ed
item.description: Sister Dibb tells a story about a man whom her father had helped and assisted, and through the story testifies of friendship and loyalty.

item.title: A More Excellent Way
item.description: Elder Wirthlin tells us that without charity, we are missing the most important aspect of Christ—His love.

item.title: All Things Work Together for Good
item.description: Elder Martino tells of a lesson taught by the Apostle Paul to the Romans, and teaches us that our trials allow us to become more like the Savior

item.title: Share Gospel with Radiance
item.description: Elder Russel M. Nelson encourages us to be a bright example to those around us, and willing to share the gospel with warmth when called upon to do so.

item.title: Exceeding Great and Precious Promises
item.description: Elder Spencer J. Condie talks about the specific blessings that come from keeping the commandments of God.

item.title: The Trial of Your Faith
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen teaches us to surround ourselves in spiritual things to help us overcome a trial of faith.

item.title: Anointing the Sick
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks teaches about the authority of the Melchizedek Priesthood.

item.title: The Tongue Is a Fire
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Holland warns us to be cautious of what we say, and to always use kidness and consideration in our words.

item.title: Light Dispels Darkness
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales tells us how we can repel the darkness of Satan with the light of Christ.

item.title: Potential to Become Like God
item.description: Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin recounts a story when President James E. Faust exemplified Christlike kindness.

item.title: Working out Our Salvation
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains that even after all our efforts at obedience and faithfulness, we must still rely on the atonement and grace of Christ.

item.title: Receiving the Lord’s Name
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar tells us that it is through the ordinances of the gospel that we take upon us the name of Christ.

item.title: There Are Two Powers on the Earth
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley warns that a war between good and evil is being waged in this world, but that we should not fear because it is a fight we will win.

item.title: Patience
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf lays out the attributes and characteristic associated with patience.

item.title: Cast Not Away Therefore Your Confidence
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Hollands warns that the most difficult oppostition often comes when we are the most diligent and faithful.

item.title: Testimony of Jesus Is the Spirit of Prophecy
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches that our testimony of Jesus Christ and the gospel can only come through personal revelation.

item.title: Serving without Love
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains that you can't be a true servant of Christ without love and selflessness.

item.title: Sacrificing for Christ’s Sake
item.description: President Spencer W. Kimball encourages us to sacrifice all that we have for the work of God.

item.title: Philosophies of Man Fall Short
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf says that while the world offers many explanations and answers, only the gospel ofJesus Christ contains the full and simple truth.

item.title: High Priest of Good Things to Come
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Hollands encourages those struggling to not lose hope, that the gospel of Jesus Christ offers happiness and help in times of trouble.

item.title: Recognize when Spirit Leaves
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar encourages us to stay out of situations that would cause the spirit to withdraw itself.

item.title: The Great Apostasy
item.description: Elder Neal A. Maxwell explains the great apostasy.

item.title: Savior Knows Our Infirmities
item.description: Elder Merrill J. Bateman teaches that the atonement was a personal experience where Christ felt our suffering on an individual basis, thus allowing him to know exactly how to help us.

item.title: Jesus Christ Is in the Express Image of His Father
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Holland explains that Jesus being in the express image of His Father is a witness to both the ancient and modern world of what God the Father is like.

item.title: Spirit of Fear
item.description: President Thomas S Monson encourages us to face with courage the trials and difficulties of the future.

item.title: Qualifications for Bishops
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley lists the qualities and attributes of successful bishops.

item.title: Counsel Concerning Wealth
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales warns us to be frugal and careful with our money.

item.description: Elder Hales explains that, in order for us to become more like Christ, we must overcome the trials and tribulations in our lives.

item.description: (1 Corinthians 13:1-13) Elder Dallin H. Oaks emphasizes the need for charity in order to obtain eternal life.

item.title: Sacramento Stake Indexing OMNI Project Trailer
item.description: The members of the Sacramento Stake participate in the OMNI project to index one million names for family history and temple work.

item.title: Indexing Training: The Difference
item.description: People from around the world can now make a difference and help others in their family history research. Indexing is a way to give back and further the work of genealogy.

item.title: Indexing Training: Recruiting
item.description: Anyone interested in family history can help. No special skills are required. Whether young or old, beginner or expert, discover your family tree by talking to people about indexing and looking for opportunities to teach.

item.title: Indexing Training: Overview
item.description: Indexing is a way that records can be converted into digital images, stored online, and provides us with an easy way to learn about our families and preserve their historical records from around the world.

item.title: Indexing Training: Leadership
item.description: Learn how to index through shadow leadership that will help encourage and motivate you to set goals that are meaningful to your family.

item.title: Indexing Training: FamilySearch Training
item.description: Overwhelmed with how to start indexing? Training lessons are available that will help you correctly and efficiently begin your FamilySearch index.

item.title: Missionaries More Fully Converted
item.description: A mission president describes the dramatic change in his missionaries once they began using family history as a finding tool. Their efforts led to greater success in baptisms and to missionaries becoming more fully converted.

item.title: They Wanted to Go Back
item.description: As new converts attend the temple to do baptisms for their own family, they feel the Spirit, their testimonies are strengthened, and they become truly converted.

item.title: We Lost My Mother
item.description: A convert who lost his mother in a car accident explains how the message of eternal families led him to be baptized so that he could do the temple work for his mother.

item.title: Just One Word: Family
item.description: A husband and wife, who recently returned to Church activity, describe the peace and happiness they felt in doing baptisms for their ancestors and being sealed together as a family.

item.title: And There's Temples On It!
item.description: A husband and wife, who recently returned to Church activity, describe the joy of sharing the gospel on both sides of the veil, and the blessings of becoming an eternal family.

item.title: It Helped Me Go On a Mission
item.description: Young people describe how their involvement in family history and temple work strengthened their testimonies of the gospel and prepared them for full-time missionary service.

item.title: I Want to Enter the Temple
item.description: An investigator attends Sacrament meeting for the first time and is so touched by the Spirit that she wants to enter the temple as soon as possible.

item.title: And Now I'm Going to Be Baptized
item.description: A widow describes how learning the doctrine of family history and temple work provided the hope that prepared her for baptism and led to her sealing in the temple.

item.title: I CouldnΓÇÖt Explain the Feeling
item.description: A convert to the Church tells how doing family history research helped her to feel the Spirit and prepared her heart to receive the gospel message.

item.title: Using Family History To Further Missionary Efforts
item.description: Missionaries describe how they can use family history in their missionary efforts.

item.title: Family History and Missionary Work-Teaching
item.description: Full-time missionaries teaching the plan of salvation through temple and family history work.

item.title: Family History and Missionary Work-Finding
item.description: Full-time missionaries using family history in their efforts to find people to teach.

item.title: Family History and Missionary Work-Retention
item.description: Full-time missionaries using temple and family history work in their convert retention efforts.

item.title: Family History and Missionary Work-Activation
item.description: Full-time missionaries using temple and family history work in their activation efforts.

item.title: Strengthen Families: Jess Family Condensed
item.description: The story of the Jess Family and how family history and temple work brought them closer together. - Condensed

item.title: Activation: Paul Felix
item.description: Paul Felix became an Elder before entering the Air Force. After getting married he always thought his wife would join the church. Now after years of inactivity and the passing of his wife he is coming back to church and going to the temple.

item.title: Missionary Work And Retention: Georgia Elias
item.description: Georgia Elias is converted to the gospel through family history work and begins her journey to the temple.

item.title: New Members And Retention: Dauphinee Family
item.description: After getting married and starting a family, Michael Dauphinee and his wife Jessica felt the need to go to church. See how family history has helped them grow in the gospel.

item.title: Help Others Add Photos and Documents to Their Family Tree
item.description: Use your knowledge to help others with their family history. As you serve your testimony of family history will be strengthened.

item.title: Help Others Find Records by Indexing
item.description: We are here to participate in the work of salvation in inviting all of these people to come unto Christ and receive the saving ordinances of the gospel.

item.title: Help Others Come Back to Church
item.description: Inviting others to do family history is a non-threatening way to help them feel the spirit and to give them motivation to visit the temple with the names that they find through their family history.

item.title: Help New Members Take a Name to the Temple
item.description: You can help new members feel that same spirit by becoming comfortable with finding ancestors and taking their names to the temple to do ordinances for them.

item.title: Help the Families You Home Teach
item.description: Sharing your family history with those you home teach is a great way to stay involved in planning and teaching.

item.title: How To Navigate the Family Tree Tool Overview
item.description: Walk through video on the basics of Family Tree. Includes navigation, view types overview and descriptions of items on Family Tree.

item.title: How To Find Your Ancestors In Your Family Tree
item.description: Walk through video on how to use the descendancy view to find ancestors.

item.title: How To Add Photos to Your Family Tree
item.description: Walk through on how to use the Memories in Family Tree to Add photos and stories.

item.title: Share Reserved Ordinances with Family and Friends
item.description: Demonstration of steps to share a reserved name in FamilySearch.org with another family member.

item.title: Finding Our Cousins: Descendancy View
item.description: This video gives instructions on how to use the Descendancy view in Family Tree to find ancestors using the hinting feature.

item.title: New Indexing Website and Program
item.description: Get the inside scoop on the new and improved indexing tool and website now in development.

item.title: FamilySearch: When Your Family Tree Is Empty!
item.description: When your Family Tree is blank, this video provides basic instructions for quickly connecting you to the records of your ancestors that exist in FamilySearch

item.title: How to Print Your Pedigree Chart
item.description: A short demonstration of how to view and print your pedigree chart.

item.title: FamilySearch: Search Tips
item.description: Use these simple tips to get started with effective family history research on FamilySearch.

item.title: Introduction to the FamilySearch Family Tree
item.description: Here are seven steps to help you become more acquainted with the new Family Tree on familysearch.org.

item.title: Working Together in Family Tree - LDS
item.description: Here are several tips to help as you work with others in Family Tree. By following these tips you can further your family history research and help others with theirs.

item.title: Access to Records at FamilySearch.org
item.description: This video explain why FamilySearch gives access to free images of records and to paid sites. It explains how they get access to historical records from archives and how they work with companies to give everyone access to those records.

item.title: Elder and Sister Dickey ΓÇô Washington DC North Mission
item.description: The Dickeys wake up each morning with the opportunity to change lives on both sides of the veil: preserving records to facilitate work for the dead and serving and sharing the gospel with the living.

item.title: "I'm a FamilySearch Missionary" Elder Marco Fernandes
item.description: Elder Marco Fernandes from Sao Paulo, Brazil explains what it is like to be a FamilySearch missionary.

item.title: Record Preservation Missionary in Peru
item.description: You can be like Brother and Sister Valientas, preservation missionaries in your own stake.

item.title: International Service Opportunities for Records Preservation Senior Missionaries
item.description: Would you like to serve a mission in a foreign country? Watch missionaries digitizing genealogical records at an Archive in Peru. Learn from their missionary experience.

item.title: I'm a FamilySearch Missionary - Sister Irene Tolley
item.description: Sister Irene Tolley from Cardston, Alberta, Canada explains what it is like to be a FamilySearch missionary.

item.title: I'm a FamilySearch Missionary - Elder David Redd
item.description: Elder David Redd from Cardston, Alberta, Canada explains what it is like to be a FamilySearch missionary serving from home.

item.title: FamilySearch Records Preservation Missionaries
item.description: Is this missionary experience for you? Watch missionaries digitizing genealogical records in archives domestically and internationally. Learn from their missionary experience.

item.title: I'm a FamilySearch Missionary-Elder and Sister Busker
item.description: Elder David Busker and Sister Leora Busker share how serving as FamilySearch missionaries has strengthened them as a couple and revitalized their lives.

item.title: A Day in the Life of a FamilySearch Missionary-Elder Allen Forsyth
item.description: What is it like to be a FamilySearch missionary? Elder Allen Forsyth explains what has helped him to be an effective missionary.

item.title: A Day in the Life of a FamilySearch Missionary in Training-Sister Queen
item.description: What is it like to be a FamilySearch missionary in training? Sister Lynnel Queen explains the training experience.

item.title: I'm A FamilySearch Missionary: Sister Horning
item.description: Sister Horning shares her experience as a FamilySearch service missionary.

item.title: Family History: Not a Program of the Church, But a Principle of the Gospel
item.description: Family History: Not a Program of the Church, But a Principle of the Gospel

item.title: FamilySearch Records Preservation: Niue Island
item.description: FamilySearch helped prevent the loss of public land, marriage, and other historical records by archiving these records before a major hurricane struck Niue Island.

item.description: (D&C 45:16-39) The Savior's parable of the fig tree teaches that we need not be frightened or troubled by the calamities that will come in the last days .

item.description: (D&C 105) Several events from the march of Zion's Camp show how it fulfilled the purposes of God.

item.description: President Monson counsels to learn and do your duty (D&C 107:99-100).

item.description: Elder Wirthlin teaches the windows of Heaven are open to the obedient (D&C 108:1-3).

item.description: This video depicts how pride led to the apostasy of Lyman Johnson and Thomas B. Marsh (D&C 112:1-16).

item.description: Elder Cook teaches that the gospel is a light and standard to the nations (D&C 115:5-6).

item.description: President Packer teaches about the Lord's counsel to Oliver Granger (D&C 117:12-15).

item.description: (D&C 119:1-3) Elder Oaks teaches how tithing funds the Lord's work.

item.description: (D&C 119:3-7) President Hinckley teaches about the miracle of tithing.

item.title: Watched Over by God: Elizabeth Panting's Journey to Zion
item.description: To join the faithful saints in Zion, Mary Panting fled her abusive husband and traveled from England to Salt Lake City with her children. Her journey was filled with difficult hardships, but also many miracles.

item.title: Endowed with Power
item.description: A dramatization of President Brigham Young speaking about the Saints receiving temple ordinances before leaving Nauvoo. President Howard W. Hunter and others speak of the blessing of participating in temple ordinances.

item.description: (D&C 138:18-37) Elder Nelson teaches that the dead waited the Atonement.
